page.title: 01THE FYLINGDALES LANDSCAPE
page.content: Standing in the heather on the moor and looking down five hundred feet, there is Fylingdales lying in an amphitheatre. Steep slopes give way to green fields where cattle graze and there are crops of oil seed rape and corn. Down the hill is Fylingthorpe where a green copper church spire juts above the red pantile roofs. Then comes the village school together with its prefabricated classroom, its playground and field. Across the road is the Fylingdales Inn and the village post office stands on the crossroads. Next to the school is the fire station with its high practice tower and radio antenna which keeps in touch with headquarters at Northallerton. The part time firemen are summoned by pocket bleepers when they are needed.
